Subject: Problem with sundials-2.3.0/MacOSX/python? Symbol not found: _N_VNew
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=77108688; y=Wny3lv9lKhLGIkG4_xX_KlIvdK1DorL94Q3cuOmxaVequV8
X-Yahoo-Profile: r_west1e

Dear all,
I have spent all day trying to get Cantera up and running on my Mac  
(Mac OS version 10.4.11) and have not yet succeeded.

I checked out Cantera from CVS, installed the latest version sundials  
(2.3.0), and built and installed everything.
In python, the simple command "Import Cantera" causes the following  
error:


   File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.5/lib/ 
python2.5/site-packages/Cantera/__init__.py", line 7, in <module>
     import _cantera
ImportError: dlopen(/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.5/ 
lib/python2.5/site-packages/Cantera/_cantera.so, 2): Symbol not  
found: _N_VNew
   Referenced from: /Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.5/ 
lib/python2.5/site-packages/Cantera/_cantera.so
   Expected in: dynamic lookup

I have tried rebuilding, reconfiguring, and redoing everything many  
times in many orders.
I have tried reconfiguring sundials with --enable-shared to allow  
dynamic shared libraries, in case that was the issue, but it still  
doesn't work.

Does anyone have any ideas?

Many thanks,

Richard
